name: google_autocomplete_search
description: Automatically complete search querys using google.

name: google_related_question_search
description: Search question others asked on google which relate to the query.

query.description: Keywords or phrases to constrain the recommend.

name: get_further_contents
description: Get detailed results from retrievaled URL.

request_url.description: URL of the desired web page.

query.description: Parameter defines the search query. You can use anything that you would use in a regular Bing Images search.

cc.description: Parameter defines the country to search from. It follows the 2-character ISO_3166-1 format. (e.g., us for United States, de for Germany, gb for United Kingdom, etc.).

count.description: Parameter controls the number of results per page. This parameter is only a suggestion and might not reflect the returned results.

query.description: Parameter defines the search query. You can use anything that you would use in a regular Yahoo! Images search.

imgt.description:
Parameter is used for filtering images by time. It can be set to:

day - Past 24 hours
week - Past week
month - Past month
year - Past year

imgty.description:
Parameter is used for filtering images by image type. It can be set to:

photo - Photo
clipart - Clipart
linedrawing - Line Drawing
gif - Animated GIF
transparent - Transparent

query.description: Parameter defines the search query. You can use anything that you would use in a regular Yandex search.
Parameter defines the search query. You can use anything that you would use in a regular YouTube search.

sp.description:
Parameter used to filter the search results:
by Upload date, you need to set the sp parameter to CAI%3D
by 4K, you need to set the sp parameter to EgJwAQ%3D%3D
...
It can also be used for forcing the exact search query spelling by setting the sp value to QgIIAQ%3D%3D.

name: ask_to_user
description: You can ask user for guidance when you think you need more information to handle the task, but you should use this tool as less as you can.

question.description: The question you want to ask to user.

name: finish
description: Finish the task and give your answer.
